1.title: Pre-Washed Lettuce and a Mime
1.plot: Christy has second thoughts about law school after a tough first day, and Bonnie is plagued by an upsetting dream.

2.title: Go-Go Boots and a Butt Cushion
2.plot: When Christy decides she doesn't need Gambler's Anonymous anymore, Bonnie vehemently disagrees.

3.title: Ambulance Chasers and a Babbling Brook
3.plot: Christy's demanding law professor leans on her a little too hard for support, and Bonnie's plan to trick Adam into choosing a wedding venue backfires.

4.title: Big Sauce and Coconut Water
4.plot: Christy is certain that Bonnie is in over her head when she invites a freshly paroled Tammy to stay with them.

5.title: Flying Monkeys and a Tank of Nitrous
5.plot: When Marjorie's husband passes away, the ladies accompany her on a trip to memorialize him.

6.title: Cottage Cheese and a Weird Buzz
6.plot: Christy and Jill clash over a gambling debt, and Bonnie's new hobby troubles Adam.

7.title: Puzzle Club and a Closet Party
7.plot: Christy and Wendy help Jill clean out her closet, which turns out to be a bigger job than expected, and Bonnie, Marjorie and Tammy take up a new hobby.

8.title: Jell-O Shots and the Truth About Santa
8.plot: Bonnie pushes Christy to mend her relationship with Violet, and Adam prepares for the grand opening of his bar.

9.title: Pork Loin and a Beat-up Monte Carlo
9.plot: Christy competes with her classmates for a prestigious internship, and Bonnie babysits Tammy following her oral surgery.

10.title: Flamingos and a Dance-Based Exercise Class
10.plot: Bonnie and the ladies help Tammy prepare for her first date since getting out of prison. Also, in order to take the edge off, Christy revisits one of her old vices.

11.title: Foot Powder and Five Feet of Vodka
11.plot: Christy's search for a Secret Santa gift leads her to discover Adam has been hiding something from Bonnie. Also, Tammy looks for a job in order to avoid being sent back to prison.

12.title: Hacky Sack and a Beautiful Experience
12.plot: Christy's smoking causes problems when the ladies take a road trip. Also, Bonnie offers Adam unsolicited business advice.

13.title: A Whistling Nostril and a Ball of Fire
13.plot: In "Big Floor Pillows and a Ball of Fire", Adam's best friend (Mitch) is back. Bonnie and Christy are not happy, but give him a chance to apologize and make amends for his actions during his last visit.

14.title: Kalamazoo And a Bad Wedge of Brie
14.plot: Christy's plan to win her sponsor's approval backfires, and the ladies rush in to help after Jill's house is broken into.

15.title: Sparkling Banter and a Failing Steel Town
15.plot: Christy is the only one without plans on Valentine's Day, so Bonnie takes her on a mother-daughter date. Also, Marjorie's attempt to have a quiet night in is ruined when everyone calls on her for help.

16.title: Skippy and the Knowledge Hole
16.plot: Christy finds it challenging to quit smoking, while Bonnie helps Tammy prepare for the GED test.

17.title: Cincinnati and a Toe Situation
17.plot:
Know what this is about?

18.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Christy, a newly sober single mother, is trying to get her life together, but is challenged when her estranged mother, Bonnie, comes back into the picture on the series premiere.

2.title: A Pee Stick and an Asian Raccoon
2.plot: Christy and Bonnie set aside their differences to deal with a family crisis together.

3.title: A Small Nervous Breakdown and a Misplaced Fork
3.plot: Christy goes on her first date since she stopped drinking. Meanwhile, Bonnie teaches her grandson Roscoe to gamble. JUSTIN LONG guest stars as her date, Adam.

4.title: Loathing and Tube Socks
4.plot: Christy's patience is tested by everyone she knows; while Bonnie runs into an old rival.

5.title: Six Thousand Bootleg T-Shirts and a Prada Handbag
5.plot: Christy makes a new friend, Regina (guest star OCTAVIA SPENCER), who has big problems. Meanwhile, Bonnie attempts to put someone else's needs ahead of her own.

6.title: Abstinence and Pudding
6.plot: Christy is determined to take things slow in her relationship with Adam. Meanwhile, Bonnie and her rival from AA, Marjorie (guest star MIMI KENNEDY), disagree on what taking it slow means.

7.title: Estrogen and a Hearty Breakfast
7.plot: Christy squares off against Luke's conservative parents (guest stars NICKY SEARCY and LAUREN BOWLES) who are upset about Violet's pregnancy. Meanwhile, Bonnie is determined not to let menopause get the best of her.

8.title: Big Sur and Strawberry Lube
8.plot: Christy is nervous about going on a romantic weekend getaway with Adam. Meanwhile, Gabriel's wife, Claudia (guest star COURTNEY HENGGELER), suspects he is cheating and seeks comfort from Christy.

9.title: Zombies and Cobb Salad
9.plot: When Bonnie loses her job and struggles to keep her life together, Christy tries to get her back on track. Octavia Spencer returns as Christy's new friend, Regina.

10.title: Belgian Waffles and Bathroom Privileges
10.plot: Christy has trouble accepting how much easier life is with Bonnie in the house. Meanwhile Baxter sets up camp in the driveway.

11.title: Cotton Candy and Blended Fish
11.plot: When Christy and Bonnie find out that Marjorie has cancer, they attempt to make their best to support her, while they try to apply her strength and patience their own lives.

12.title: Corned Beef and Handcuffs
12.plot: Christy gets stuck in the middle when Bonnie and Chef Rudy start dating. Two and a Half Men star JON CRYER directed the episode.

13.title: Hot Soup and Shingles
13.plot: When Christy sprains her ankle, she refuses to admit she needs Bonnie's help. Meanwhile, Luke turns to Baxter for advice about being a father.

14.title: Leather Cribs and Medieval Rack
14.plot: Christy and Bonnie come clean about the secrets they've been keeping from each other. Meanwhile, Violet and Luke discover they have different ideas about parenting. KEVIN POLLAK guest stars as Christy's father, Alvin.

15.title: Fireballs and Bullet Holes
15.plot: Christy tries to start a relationship with her father, Alvin (KEVIN POLLAK), while Bonnie struggles to accept the fact that Christy wants him in her life.

16.title: Nietzsche and a Beer Run
16.plot: Christy is tempted by her old vices when she dates an attractive, hard-partying man named David (guest star NICK ZANO). Bonnie decides her advice is worth money and becomes a life coach.

17.title: Jail Jail and Japanese Porn
17.plot: When Christy puts her new relationship with David ahead of her friends and family, Bonnie has to pick up the slack.

18.title: Sonograms and Tube Tops
18.plot: Violet is nervous about becoming a mom, so Christy plans a baby shower to get her excited. Meanwhile, Bonnie scores a new life-coaching client.

19.title: Toilet Wine and the Earl of Sandwich
19.plot: Christy and Bonnie help Regina tie up loose ends on the way to drop her off at prison. Meanwhile, Alvin spends the day getting to know his grandkids.

20.title: Clumsy Monkeys and a Tilted Uterus
20.plot: While looking through possible couples to adopt the baby, Violet faces Luke about his refusal to put the baby in adoption. Meanwhile, Christy considers the possibility of finishing high school.

21.title: Broken Dreams and Blocked Arteries
21.plot: Christy is caught in the middle when tensions rise between Bonnie and Alvin. Meanwhile, a very pregnant Violet is apprehensive about going to her senior prom.

22.title: Smokey Taylor and a Deathbed Confession
22.plot: Christy and Bonnie help Violet through labor. Meanwhile, Christy is convinced that Bonnie still has feelings for Alvin.

1.title: Hepatitis and Lemon Zest
1.plot: Christy takes up the role of sponsoring a recovering alcoholic while battling her own addiction to gambling.

2.title: Figgy Pudding and the Rapture
2.plot: Living in a motel takes a toll on Christy and her family as their challenges seem to grow by the second. Violet makes a gut-wrenching decision.

3.title: Chicken Nuggets and a Triple Homicide
3.plot: Christy and Bonnie attempt to bring the family back together by leasing a house which has an interesting history, while in the meantime, Bonnie works as the go-between for Christy and Alvin in an effort to bring peace to their relationship.

4.title: Forged Resumes and the Recommended Dosage
4.plot: While Christy tries to get to the bottom of Violet's erratic behavior, Bonnie attempts to land a well-paid job.

5.title: Kimchi and a Monkey Playing Harmonica
5.plot: Christy has mixed feelings about Baxter's relationship with his new girlfriend, Candace, while Bonnie and Alvin's romance heats up.

6.title: Crazy Eyes and a Wet Brad Pitt
6.plot: Christy and Bonnie relish being in the lap of luxury when Christy's wealthy sponsee, Jill, asks them to keep her company on her first night out of rehab.

7.title: Soapy Eyes and a Clean Slate
7.plot: Christy decides to right the wrongs of her past, but has a blind spot when it comes to Baxter. Following Christy's example, Bonnie decides to come clean with Alvin about the terrible things she did to him during their relationship.

8.title: Free Therapy and a Dead Lady's Yard Sale
8.plot: Family secrets are revealed when Christy and Bonnie are asked to join Violet's therapy session.

9.title: Godzilla and a Sprig of Mint
9.plot: Christy's evening alone takes an unexpected turn when she meets her attractive, single neighbor, Andy. Meanwhile, Bonnie and Alvin's romantic plans are derailed by Alvin's ex-wife, Lorraine.

10.title: Nudes and a Six-Day Cleanse
10.plot: Depressed that she has been a waitress longer than she intended, Christy moves toward a career change. Meanwhile, Bonnie and Alvin try to revisit their youth.

11.title: Three Smiles and an Unpainted Ceiling
11.plot: The Plunkett household is rocked by an unexpected death.

12.title: Kitty Litter and a Class A Felony
12.plot: Christy performs damage control when Bonnie acts out after the death of a loved one. Beverly D'Angelo returns as Alvin's ex-wife.

13.title: Cheeseburger Salad and Jazz
13.plot: Christy discovers the shrine Bonnie has built, and tricks her into therapy, which backfires on Christy when Bonnie latches on to a mechanic who vaguely resembles Alvin.

14.title: Benito Poppins and a Warm Pumpkin
14.plot: When Christy gets promoted to manager of the restaurant, she discovers that being the boss comes with its own set of problems. Meanwhile, Bonnie encounters a nemesis in the building who wants to have her fired.

15.title: Turkey Meatballs and a Getaway Car
15.plot: After Claudia almost catches Christy and Gabriel together, Christy finds that she enjoys lovemaking when there is a danger of being caught. Meanwhile, Bonnie becomes secretary of the AA's women's meetings, but takes the job too seriously.

16.title: Dirty Money and a Woman Named Mike
16.plot: Bonnie and Christy are shocked when they learn how much prison has changed their friend, Regina.

17.title: A Commemorative Coin and a Misshapen Head
17.plot: Christy and Bonnie are shocked to discover that Violet's new boyfriend, Gregory, is a psychology professor at the junior college, and also twenty-three years older than her.

18.title: Dropped Soap and a Big Guy on a Throne
18.plot: Christy and Bonnie face temptation when Bonnie is prescribed pain medication for a back injury.

19.title: Mashed Potatoes and a Little Nitrous
19.plot: In hopes of concealing her relapse from Christy, Bonnie resorts to extreme measures.

20.title: Sick Popes and a Red Ferrari
20.plot: After Bonnie's relapse, Marjorie, Jill and Wendy rally around to help her through withdrawal from painkillers, but Christy wants no part of it.

21.title: Patient Zero and the Chocolate Fountain
21.plot: Bonnie and Christy's contentious relationship makes them unwelcome everywhere they go.

22.title: Fun Girl Stuff and Eternal Salvation
22.plot: When Roscoe announces that he has decided to go live with his father, Christy blames Bonnie.

1.title: Terrorists and Gingerbread
1.plot: Bonnie and Christy disagree about forgiveness when Bonnie's estranged mother returns and wants to be a part of their lives.

2.title: Thigh Gap and a Rack of Lamb
2.plot: Christy and Bonnie try to help Jodi, a teenage addict who they meet at a meeting, while Christy tackles problems both at work and home.

3.title: Mozzarella Sticks and a Gay Piano Bar
3.plot: After Christy and Bonnie get Jodi, a recovering drug addict back on her feet, they find themselves addicted to the rush of helping others and take on a new "project": Michelle.

4.title: Sawdust and Brisket
4.plot: Christy is overjoyed when Violet wants to improve their relationship and spend more time together, while Bonnie tries to win over a disgruntled tenant.

5.title: A Pirate, Three Frogs and a Prince
5.plot: Christy feels threatened by Roscoe's relationship with Candace, while a lonely Bonnie flirts with Steve, which produces unintended results.

6.title: Horny-Goggles and a Catered Intervention
6.plot: Christy and Bonnie try to be supportive when Regina tells them she no longer thinks she is an alcoholic, while Wendy tries to convince the others to attend a sober holiday dance.

7.title: Kreplach and a Tiny Tush
7.plot: Christy hosts a family dinner for Violet's difficult future mother-in-law, Phyllis, while Bonnie balks when Steve wants to take their relationship to the next level.

8.title: Snickerdoodle and a Nip Slip
8.plot: Christy dates Candace's father, much to Bonnie's delight, and Baxter and Candace's horror.

9.title: My Little Pony and a Demerol Drip
9.plot: Christy's burgeoning relationship with Fred gets more and more difficult for Candace to handle, while Bonnie enjoys the perks of Christy dating a wealthy man.

10.title: Quaaludes and Crackerjack
10.plot: In order to avoid her ex-boyfriend, Bonnie drags Christy to a new AA meeting, only to run into her ex-girlfriend from 30 years ago, Jeanine.

11.title: Cinderella and a Drunk MacGyver
11.plot: Christy tries to help Julian, a handsome, newly sober AA member, but her attraction to him complicates things, while Bonnie jumps at the chance to attend a lavish charity gala with Jill.

12.title: Diabetic Lesbians and a Blushing Bride
12.plot: When Marjorie announces she and Victor are getting married, Christy and Bonnie are determined to make it the perfect day in spite of Victor's sister Anya's objections.

13.title: Sticky Hands and a Walk on the Wild Side
13.plot: Christy, Jill and Wendy find themselves in a sticky situation when they agree to help Bonnie smuggle an illegal substance across the Canadian border.

14.title: Death, Death, Death and a Bucket of Chicken
14.plot: Christy tries to be supportive when a health scare throws Bonnie into a tailspin.

15.title: Nazi Zombies and a Two-Hundred-Pound Baby
15.plot: Bonnie tries to get Christy to admit that she still has feelings for Baxter.

16.title: Cornflakes and the Hair of Three Men
16.plot: When Christy temporarily loses her job, Jill takes her on as a personal assistant, while Bonnie answers a wrong number and starts a quasi-relationship with the mysterious male caller.

17.title: Caperberries and a Glass Eye
17.plot: Christy encourages Bonnie to give Adam another chance and go on a date with him, only to discover that he may not be all that he seems.

18.title: Beast Mode and Old People Kissing
18.plot: When Jodi's boyfriend, Travis, turns up at an AA meeting, Christy finds it difficult to put aside her anger towards him, while Adam feels neglected by Bonnie.

19.title: A Catheter and a Dipsy-Doodle
19.plot: Despite being extremely ill, Christy insists on taking her final exams. Meanwhile, Bonnie is furious when she suspects that Adam is cheating on her.

20.title: Pure Evil and a Free Piece of Cheesecake
20.plot: Christy learns she has made the Dean's List at school, but is disappointed by Bonnie's lackluster response, which leads to conflict.

21.title: Mahjong Sally and the Ecstasy
21.plot: Violet unexpectedly returns home, revealing her engagement to Gregory is off, however, upon hearing different stories about the breakup, Christy and Bonnie are confused about what actually happened.

22.title: Atticus Finch and the Downtrodden
22.plot: Christy becomes discouraged when she realizes how much it will cost to become a lawyer, while Bonnie tries to discipline Violet.

1.title: High-Tops and Brown Jacket
1.plot: Bonnie and Adam's relationship is tested when she allows him to move in for a few weeks. Also, Christy learns the hard way that it may be a mistake to try and meet men with Jill.

2.title: Sword Fights and a Dominican Shortstop
2.plot: Bonnie's ex-girlfriend offers Christy a lucrative real estate job; Adam wants to know more about Bonnie's past relationships with women.

3.title: Sparkling Water and Ba-Dinkers
3.plot: Bonnie thinks she's no longer desirable when she catches Adam smoking pot before sex.

4.title: Curious George and the Big Red Nightmare
4.plot: Christy and Bonnie think Roscoe has a drug problem when Baxter and Candace catch him smoking pot.

5.title: Blow and a Free McMuffin
5.plot: Violet is sick. Christy and Bonnie are rushing to her only to find out that having mono is the least of her problems.

6.title: Xanax and a Baby Duck
6.plot: Christy keeps a constant eye on Roscoe when she learns he's been using drugs and alcohol.

7.title: Cornbread and a Cashmere Onesie
7.plot: Christy and Bonnie worry about Jill when she cries for help on the anniversary of her mother's suicide.

8.title: Freckled Bananas and a Little Schwinn
8.plot: Christy and Bonnie resume illegal activities, leading Adam to question their morality.

9.title: Bad Hand and British Royalty
9.plot: Christy and Bonnie have their hands full when Adam's hard-partying friends come to visit.

10.title: A Safe Word and a Rib Eye
10.plot: Bonnie and the ladies keep Jill's pregnancy a secret, causing Christy to feel left out.

11.title: Good Karma and the Big Weird
11.plot: Bonnie encourages Christy to pursue Marjorie's charming nephew Nick, despite the fact that he's been declared off limits.

12.title: Wind Chimes and a Bottomless Pit of Sadness
12.plot: Christy, Bonnie, Jill and Wendy get high after accidentally eating cookies filled with marijuana.

13.title: A Bouncy Castle and an Aneurysm
13.plot: Christy worries that Bonnie is jeopardizing her relationship with Adam when Bonnie connects with a handsome stranger.

14.title: Roast Chicken and a Funny Story
14.plot: Bonnie drives everyone crazy after breaking up with Adam, so Christy tries to get them back together.

15.title: Night Swimmin' and an English Muffin
15.plot: When Bonnie discovers that Adam is still close with his ex-wife, Danielle (guest star WENDIE MALICK), Christy worries the emotional fallout could jeopardize Bonnie's sobriety.

16.title: Martinis and a Sponge Bath
16.plot: When Christy and Adam get into a car accident, Bonnie is hurt to discover she is neither of their emergency contacts. Wendie Malick returns as Adam's ex-wife, Danielle.

17.title: Black Mold and an Old Hot Dog
17.plot: Christy helps Jill adjust to being a foster mother; Bonnie tries to convince tenants she's a good building manager.

18.title: Tush Push and Some Radishes
18.plot: After Bonnie's mother dies, Bonnie and Christy discover a big secret she kept.

19.title: Tantric Sex and the Sprouted Flute
19.plot: Christy adopts her new boyfriend's healthy lifestyle, while Bonnie and Adam take their relationship to the next level.

20.title: A Cricket and a Hedge Made of Gold
20.plot: When Marjorie takes a break from the group, Bonnie becomes the go-to for everyone's problems, and Christy tries to overcome a painful memory from her past.

21.title: A Few Thongs and a Hawaiian Funeral
21.plot: Christy and Jill take Emily to see her biological mother, Natasha (guest star MISSI PYLE), in rehab where they make a surprising discovery. Meanwhile, Bonnie watches Adam's dog while he's out of town.

22.title: Lockjaw and a Liquid Diet
22.plot: On the fourth season finale, Christy tries to help when Bonnie gets into trouble with the IRS. Realizing she's in over her head, she encourages Bonnie so seek help from her newfound brother, Ray (guest star LEONARD ROBERTS).

1.title: Twinkle Lights and Grandma Shoes
1.plot: In the fifth season premiere episode, Bonnie gets cold feet when considering her future with Adam, and Christy risks failing an important test in order to help a fellow alcoholic. Missi Pyle returns as Natasha, the birth mother of Jill's foster daughter.

2.title: Fish Town and Too Many Thank You's
2.plot: Bonnie is suspicious when her brother, Ray (recurring guest star LEONARD ROBERTS) returns from rehab and strikes up a friendship with Adam, and Christy and Bonnie have a brush with the law when they take Ray's fancy car for a joy ride.

3.title: A Seafaring Ancestor and a Bloomin' Onion
3.plot: Christy gets romantically involved with her much younger study partner while Bonnie rents out one of the basement apartments to Natasha.

4.title: Fancy Crackers and Giant Women
4.plot: Bonnie suffers withdrawal after giving up cable TV to help Christy pay for her law school applications. And the women rally around Jill after she has a breakdown in her favorite department store.

5.title: Poodle Fuzz and a Twinge of Jealousy
5.plot: When an injury temporarily lands Bonnie in a wheelchair, Christy is forced to take over as building manager and makes a surprising discovery.

6.title: Smooth Jazz and a Weird Floaty Eye
6.plot: Bonnie insists on meeting Adam's estranged brother, Patrick; things get weird when Patrick takes a romantic interest in Christy.

7.title: Too Many Hippies and Huevos Rancheros
7.plot: Christy and Bonnie rally around Marjorie when her husband has a stroke.

8.title: An Epi-Pen and a Security Cat
8.plot: After their home is robbed at Christmastime, Christy and Bonnie's search for the thief leads to an unlikely door.

9.title: Teenage Vampires and a White Russian
9.plot: Bonnie is upset when her brother calls Adam instead of her to bail him out of jail; Christy gets fired from the restaurant.

10.title: A Bear and a Bladder Infection
10.plot: Christy seeks the company of a former fling when her long-distance relationship seems to fizzle; Bonnie tries to give up coffee.

11.title: Bert and Ernie and a Blessing of the People
11.plot: Bonnie and Adam realize they're not on the same page when they attend a traditional wedding; Christy and Patrick try to find the right mood for their "first time".

12.title: Push-Down Coffee and a Working Turn Signal
12.plot: When Christy's car dies, Bonnie refuses to let Adam loan her money for a new one.

13.title: Pudding and a Screen Door
13.plot: Jill returns from her wellness retreat a changed woman, but Bonnie is offended when she refuses to pay for lunch; Christy's plans for the future are thrown off-track.

14.title: Charlotte Bronte and a Backhoe
14.plot: Bonnie locks horns with Jill's 'inner strength' coach, Miranda (Kristin Chenoweth). Also, Christy struggles to bounce back after being rejected from law school.

15.title: Esta Loca and a Little Klingon
15.plot: Christy and Bonnie help Jill get sober again, and Christy's boyfriend, Patrick, is less than understanding when it ruins his birthday weekend.

16.title: Eight Cats and the Hat Show
16.plot: Christy is blindsided by a surprising offer from her boyfriend, Patrick. Also, Bonnie struggles to be the stable one in her relationship after Adam experiences a devastating loss.

17.title: Crazy Snakes and a Clog to the Head
17.plot: When the ladies bring a meeting to a women's prison, Bonnie is attacked by an old acquaintance, Tammy, and Christy helps Bonnie make amends.

18.title: Spaghetti Sauce and a Dumpster Fire
18.plot: Christy considers getting a new sponsor, Nora, after witnessing Marjorie have a major meltdown in a grocery store, and Bonnie tries her hand at being a supportive friend.

19.title: A Taco Bowl and a Tubby Seamstress
19.plot: Christy is concerned that she and Bonnie might lose their apartment when Bonnie locks horns with the tough new building owner, Rita.

20.title: Ocular Fluid and Fighting Robots
20.plot: Christy's sponsor challenges her to be nice to Bonnie at all costs, and Bonnie is convinced that Adam has stopped making an effort.

21.title: Phone Confetti and a Wee Dingle
21.plot: Christy and Bonnie's relaxing trip to a spa takes a turn when Bonnie lands in jail.

22.title: Diamond Earrings and a Pumpkin Head
22.plot: Christy falls back into old habits; and Bonnie worries about her well-being.

1.title: Episode #7.1
1.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Episode #8.1
1.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

locations: Stage 20, Warner Brothers Burbank Studios - 4000 Warner Boulevard, Burbank, California, USA::(studio)
imdb.plot outline: Single mom Christy has her hands full with two children, Violet and Roscoe, and maintaining newfound sobriety, when her passive-aggressive, recovering-alcoholic mother re-enters the picture, brimming with criticisms about Christy's life. As the daughter works to be the best mother she can and to overcome mistakes she made, she must also navigate dysfunctional relationships with romantic interests, and with her irresponsible ex-husband, Baxter. Despite the uphill battle, Christy tries to remain positive and stay on a path to help her reach her goals.
imdb.title: Mom
plot: A newly sober single mom tries to pull her life together in Napa Valley while dealing with her wayward mother.::CBS

Single mom Christy has her hands full with two children, Violet and Roscoe, and maintaining newfound sobriety, when her passive-aggressive, recovering-alcoholic mother re-enters the picture, brimming with criticisms about Christy's life. As the daughter works to be the best mother she can and to overcome mistakes she made, she must also navigate dysfunctional relationships with romantic interests, and with her irresponsible ex-husband, Baxter. Despite the uphill battle, Christy tries to remain positive and stay on a path to help her reach her goals.::Jwelch5742

camera: Panavision Panaflex Cameras, Panavision Primo Lenses (Pilot only)
